topic: Deep dive: cProfile standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: cProfile standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: cProfile Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an in-depth look at the cProfile module, a powerful profiling tool available in Python 3.12+ for measuring the performance of your code.
key_points: cProfile offers both detailed and compact profile output formats for thorough analysis.
It can generate per-function and per-statement statistics to help identify bottlenecks.
The module uses a decorator or function wrapper for easy integration into your code.
Profiling results can be saved to a file or used interactively in the Python interpreter.

code_examples.code:
import cProfile, pstats

p = cProfile.Profile()

p.run('import sys; print("Hello World!\n", __name__, file=open("profiler_output.txt", "w"))'

p.dump_stats(sort=pstats.SortKey.TIME)

version_notes: cProfile has been a part of Python since version 3.12.
In previous versions, it was known as the 'profile' module.
caveats: Using cProfile for profiling can affect the performance of your code slightly due to the overhead of the profiler itself.
For more advanced profiling needs, third-party tools like perftools or line_profiler may be required.
